title: Is it too late to get your degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: look at it realistically, you have 45 years to work, today some work 35 years. Can you pay off your education and make a couple of million at the very least in 35 years with all the downturns, floods, hurricanes, pandemics, taking in your relatives in old age, helping pay your kids’ education, buying a house and a couple of cars, and still come out a head? If you start out late to get your degree you will more than likely get lost in the shuffle. One of the reasons is today employees do teamwork in hiring and if you’re older you won’t get hired because of them.

Basically, it really isn’t too late to go to school and get a degree. The difference is how will your situation be accepted by society and the business community. Possibly, you may be able to be more successful, going out on your own after getting any qualifications to enter a vocation. Start your own business. Then maybe with your new credentials and your past experience you could be successful in your efforts. I believe you can find some real life stories on individuals who have followed this path.

Ok, I am 74 and finishing a certification course in medical ethics from the university of Pennsylvania school of medicine. No my degrees were not from other high prestige schools, and the last one I got was in 1991. Maybe more to your point, there was a young woman who worked in our HR department in systems analysis. She was not qualified for promotion because she had not attended college. I mean no credits. I encouraged her to try online degree programs and within a year following that conversation she had enrolled in southern New Hampshire university. A month ago she completed her Bachelors and is going forward for her masters. please be aware to stay away from for profit colleges. Hiring managers don’t take those degrees seriously. There are plenty of regular non profit universities like penn state that offer complete programs on line. hope that encourages you!

It’s never too late. You can find wonderful stories of people who had to abandon their studies due to reasons beyond their will. At some point, they decided to go ahead and go to school and get a degree. It depends on what it means for you to get a degree, how much time and money are you willing to spend to pursue this degree, your family and labor situation. Just keep in mind that there is no age limit to pursue your dreams.

It really is never too late. You read stories all the time about 75 year-olds receiving a Bachelor degree. If this is something that your brain and heart are set to do——-do it! Don’t let the age issue interfere. Yes, you’ll be older than the other students and maybe older than the instructors and professors but don’t let that dissuade you. You will enjoy the learning process much better than the young crowd and you may learn considerable more once you get into the studying routine. And, don’t kid yourself getting into the studying routine is going to be a real chore

actually its never to late most college if you look around there are many adults that are older then 30 still going to colege to get degrees because they either dropped out didnt go to college right out of highschoolhad childen or traveled and now are wanting to get there degrees in schooling so it is never ot late as long as you put effort into it

When I graduated with my doctorate (at age 40) one of my fellow graduates was a 77 year-old woman who was graduating with hers. And here’s a story about a 107 year-old who recently earned her doctorate (She Waited 77 Years to Receive her Doctorate - The Oldest Person to Ever get It). Are you younger than 107? If so, you’re not yet too old.
My Mom got her degree at age 55 years. If you have the energy, it’s not too late. If you don’t have the energy, there is no point in going.
